title: Canadian Judge Rules That Emoji Constitutes Assent in a Contract
description: As various states begin to enact laws banning certain types of gender-affirming care for transgender minors, legal challenges are beginning to result in different outcomes in courts across the country. Recently in Montana, a judge temporarily blocked such a ban imposed by the legislature, and judges in other jurisdictions and federal courts have issued similar orders. However, the U.S. Sixth Circuit recently reached a different conclusion, reversing preliminary injunctions against gender-affirming care bans in Tennessee and Kentucky.
Catch up on this and other breaking news on the Justia Legal News Blog.
